snippet: A tour of St. Patrick’s Cathedral, St. Mary the Virgin and the Church of St. Ignatius Loyola reveal the personalities of the instruments that can both caress and crush.
abstract: Paul Jacobs, traveling virtuoso and chairman of Juilliard music school's organ department, conducts private tour of New York’s finest pipe organs; trek, which stops at St Patrick’s Cathedral, Church of St Ignatius Loyola and Church of St Mary the Virgin, offers lessons and demonstrations on harmonic personalities of each musical behemoth.
lead_paragraph: A tour of St. Patrick’s Cathedral, St. Mary the Virgin and the Church of St. Ignatius Loyola reveal the personalities of the instruments that can both caress and crush.

headline.main: On the Organ Trail in Manhattan
headline.print_headline: On the Organ Trail in Manhattan
